summary: As of March 2020, nonfederal pay (e.g., for state and local government and private sector workers) was on average 23% higher than federal pay for similar jobs, despite pay equity efforts. One such effort was to increase federal pay in specific areas of the U.S. where nonfederal workers make at least 5% more. The heads of the Department of Labor and the Offices of Management...
title: Human Capital: Administration and Implementation of the General Schedule Locality Pay Program
